definition: (of a woman) to dress as a man (idiom)
archaic variant of 汝[ru3]
female/woman/daughter
to disguise oneself as/to dress up/to play (a role)/to put on (an expression)
male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: She disguised herself as a man by a false beard.
sentences.chinese: 她戴上假鬍子女扮男裝。

sentences.english: Th is young judge was really Port ia dressed as a man.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這位年輕的法官就是女扮男裝的波西亞。

sentences.english: Clove learned that case is not trust, disguised as men returned to the town of rock.
sentences.chinese: 丁香得知情況卻不放心，女扮男裝回到了磐石鎮。

sentences.english: This pope he claimed was a woman disguised as a man.
sentences.chinese: 他稱，這是一位女扮男裝的教皇。

sentences.english: The image of women disguised as men is an important type of female images in Chinese literature.
sentences.chinese: 女扮男裝形象是中國文學中的重要女性形象類型之一。

sentences.english: Mulan is the Middle Kingdom's gender-bending heroine, its Joan of Arc.
sentences.chinese: 木蘭是一位女扮男裝的英雄，中國的聖女貞德。

sentences.english: Of course, women did disguise themselves and enlist as men.
sentences.chinese: 當然，女人女扮男裝，然後參軍。

sentences.english: She disguised herself in man's clothes.
Weiaola to dress like a man, alias places where do the duke's young people.
sentences.chinese: 薇奧拉女扮男裝，化名西薩里奧做了公爵的少年侍人。

definition: lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
contemporary drama
bourgeois tragedy
quarrelsome but loving couple
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
harmony is to be prized
female warrior role in Chinese opera
lit. to govern from behind the curtain/to rule in place of the emperor (idiom)
Danny Lee Sau-Yin (1953-), Hong Kong actor and director
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
an extra (in a movie)
Zhang Jingchu (1980-), PRC actress
crafty and unruly
talented and good-looking (idiom)
